jupyterNotebook.html:
Load data

Basic stacked area chart

# library
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create data
x=range(1,6)
y1=[1,23,2,18,9]
y2=[22,52,27,13,12]
y3=[22,8,65,12,16]

# Basic stacked area chart.
plt.stackplot(x,y1, y2, y3, labels=['A','B','C'])
[<matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fb5fdf0>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fb6d130>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fb6d400>]

Change the baseline parameter


# Basic stacked area chart.
plt.stackplot(x,y1, y2, y3, labels=['A','B','C'], baseline='sym')
[<matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fbf5fa0>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fa1ef40>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fc034f0>]

Let's get smooth with interp1d

from scipy.interpolate import make_interp_spline
tnew = np.linspace(1, 5, num=100, endpoint=True)
f = make_interp_spline(x, y1, k=2)
y1Smooth = f(tnew)

f = make_interp_spline(x, y2, k=2)
y2Smooth = f(tnew)

f = make_interp_spline(x, y3, k=2)
y3Smooth = f(tnew)


plt.stackplot(tnew, y1Smooth, y2Smooth, y3Smooth, labels=['A','B','C'], baseline='zero')
[<matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fd299a0>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fd29c40>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fd29f10>]
plt.stackplot(tnew, y1Smooth, y2Smooth, y3Smooth, labels=['A','B','C'], baseline='sym')
[<matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fdb86d0>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fdb89d0>,
 <matplotlib.collections.PolyCollection at 0x12fdb8ca0>]

Make it pretty

  • Change colors
  • add labels at the right place manually

metadata.title: Streamgraph with Python and Matplotlib
metadata.description: Streamcharts are a bit tricky to build with Python and Matplotlib. This blogpost will guide you through a complete example, starting with a stacked area chart and transforming it into a streamgraph thanks to data interpolation.
metadata.seoDescription: This post explains how to build a stream graph with Matplotlib. Code snippets with explanations are provided.
metadata.keywords: python, chart, plot, seaborn, matplotlib, streamgraph
